content: So I forgot it was Monday. Observationally, so did everyone else. Motion that we skip meetings for December?
I actually had a meeting and noticed no one else said anything so left it alone :smile:
I'm ok with skipping or not skipping
I remembered that it was Monday, but was cleaning the garage at the time, and was kinda on a tight schedule because there's very limited daylight this time of the year.
We're currently in maximum daylight here, but have a grouchy teething baby so have missed a lot of it. I'm on board with a quiet December to try build up some enthusiasm for next month :smile:
this turned out to be unusually fortuitous because most of my hardware broke in December, lolsob, and I only just now got back on track w/r/t fixing things up.
just get an rpi4 and become even more of our ARM expert than you already are
Maybe if we all purge MMX from our brains we can replace it with ARM
Is the rpi4 representative of other ARM CPUs? I might need to get one...
lolol.
@Caleb Zulawski The RPi4's architecture is aarch64, so I am not sure I would say "representative of other ARM CPUs" because there's a lot of variation, but it's a highly relevant one.
I suppose I meant in terms of performance etc
I've worked a lot with aarch64 but only abstractly.
For example my AMD APU performance isn't remotely similar to most intel CPUs because of AMD's implementation of AVX, I think
Not sure if aarch64 has that problem (I would hope not)
it's a quad core uh, 1.4GHz I think
but it's V8 and supports Neon
I actually have two sitting in a box, but no place to put a spare keyboard and screen and such

@Caleb Zulawski NEON is... reasonably consistent across aarch64, is my (mostly intellectual and abstract on this detail, not as material and tested) understanding.

https://www.cnx-software.com/2017/08/07/how-arm-nerfed-neon-permute-instructions-in-armv8/ is the only case I've seen where it's not, and the RPi 4B will share its perf characteristics with most things because it has a "bigger" core (the A72). Note, however, the RPi 3, which I have, will have different characteristics, for the reasons in that article.

https://www.cnx-software.com/2015/04/09/relative-performance-of-arm-cortex-a-32-bit-and-64-bit-cores/ I should note though that just because one op has a weird relative glitch in performance doesn't mean that the results are overall slower. :P
